summary: George Edward Wright is mentioned in several CIA documents related to Black militants and hijackers in the early 1970s. He is identified as a Black Panther member who traveled from Algiers to Paris. While in Paris, he and other Black Panther members were reportedly receiving support from Henri Curiel's organization to obtain plastic surgery and false documentation for re-entry into the U.S. The CIA requested photos to aid in their identification. Other documents mention the movements and activities of Black militants/hijackers, including their desire to return to the U.S. for revolutionary activities.
significance: Based on the provided documents, George Edward Wright's significance is related to his involvement with the Black Panther Party and his activities related to potentially re-entering the U.S. with false documentation. There is no direct connection to the JFK assassination context mentioned in these documents.
